metadata.title: Week 1 Day 2: Introduction to Latin Nouns

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules. Familiarity with the concept of nouns in English, including singular and plural forms, is essential. Students should also recall the importance of word endings in Latin for determining grammatical function. This foundational knowledge will support their understanding of Latin noun cases and declensions.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we introduced the Latin alphabet and practiced pronunciation. Students learned the significance of vowel and consonant sounds in forming words.

primary: Understand the concept of Latin nouns

lesson_flow.description: Review the Latin alphabet and pronunciation rules.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students recite the alphabet and practice pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Ensure correct pronunciation and address any errors.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the concept of nouns in Latin, focusing on singular and plural forms.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on the introduction of nouns.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use examples from English to relate to Latin nouns.

lesson_flow.description: Practice identifying singular and plural nouns using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in identifying and categorizing nouns.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide immediate feedback and correct misconceptions.

lesson_flow.description: Students complete a worksheet on singular and plural nouns.
lesson_flow.student_action: Work individually to complete the worksheet.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to offer assistance and check for understanding.

lesson_flow.description: Summarize the lesson and preview the next topic.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and ask questions about the day's lesson.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of noun recognition in Latin.
